learningObjectives.text: Apply quantitative research methods to analyze donor behavior patterns and retention trends

traceability.employerNeed: Clear analysis of donor retention patterns with supporting data
traceability.studentGoal: Understand how organizations use data to make decisions
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Apply disciplinary knowledge to solve real-world problems

learningObjectives.text: Translate analytical findings into clear, actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders

traceability.employerNeed: Evidence-based recommendations our development team can implement
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Demonstrate professional communication skills in workplace settings

learningObjectives.text: Design and deliver a professional presentation synthesizing research findings for board-level audiences

traceability.employerNeed: A presentation our board can understand and act on
traceability.studentGoal: Build confidence communicating with senior professionals
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Demonstrate professional communication skills in workplace settings

learningObjectives.text: Apply psychological principles of motivation and behavior to understand donor engagement patterns

traceability.studentGoal: Explore applications of psychology in business settings
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Apply disciplinary knowledge to solve real-world problems

learningObjectives.text: Demonstrate professional workplace behaviors including initiative, time management, and responsive communication

traceability.studentGoal: Build confidence communicating with senior professionals
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Collaborate effectively with professionals and stakeholders

learningObjectives.text: Reflect critically on professional development and articulate growth in career-relevant competencies

traceability.studentGoal: Explore applications of psychology in business settings
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Reflect critically on personal and professional development

objectives: Understand organizational context and project scope

activities.description: Meet with Development Director for project kickoff and context setting
Review donor database structure, data dictionary, and available reports
Reflect on initial impressions and identify knowledge gaps
Read: Introduction to nonprofit fundraising metrics and donor lifecycle
Draft preliminary analysis plan with timeline and milestones

deliverables: Project plan with timeline and milestones

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what did you learn about the organization during orientation? What specific challenges did they share about donor retention?
dealReflection.examine: How does this nonprofit context differ from academic research settings you've experienced in your Psychology studies? What assumptions might you need to challenge?
dealReflection.articulate: Anna, what skills from your Research Methods course do you anticipate using most? What new skills do you think you'll need to develop?

activities.description: Perform data cleaning and quality assessment on donor records
Weekly mentor check-in: discuss data observations and questions
Read: Donor segmentation strategies and RFM analysis methods
Create initial descriptive statistics and data visualizations

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what patterns or surprises emerged from your initial look at the data? What data quality issues did you encounter?
dealReflection.examine: How do real-world data challenges compare to the clean datasets you've worked with in coursework? What ethical considerations arise when working with donor information?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about the gap between textbook analysis and applied research? How might this change your approach going forward?

objectives: Refine analytical approach based on initial findings

activities.description: Apply segmentation methodology to donor database
Discuss preliminary segments with Development Director for validation
Read: Research on donor motivation and giving psychology
Refine segmentation criteria based on feedback and test alternatives

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what segmentation approach did you use and why? How did stakeholder feedback influence your thinking?
dealReflection.examine: How do concepts from Consumer Psychology apply to donor behavior? What connections do you see between motivation theory and giving patterns?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about balancing analytical rigor with practical applicability? How has this shaped your professional perspective?

objectives: Identify significant patterns in donor retention data

activities.description: Complete second analysis iteration with refined segmentation
Weekly mentor check-in: present initial patterns, gather feedback
Read: From Data to Decisions - Building compelling analytical arguments
Draft outline of key findings for interim report

deliverables: Analysis checkpoint: Key patterns with supporting evidence

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what patterns emerged from your analysis this week? What surprised you most about what the data revealed?
dealReflection.examine: How do you distinguish correlation from causation in this context? What additional information would strengthen your conclusions?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about how organizations use data to make decisions? How does this differ from academic research approaches?

objectives: Gather stakeholder perspectives on preliminary findings

activities.description: Conduct brief interviews with 2-3 development staff members
Synthesize interview insights with quantitative findings
Read: Stakeholder engagement in organizational research
Revise analysis framework based on stakeholder input

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what did you learn from staff interviews that wasn't visible in the data? How did practitioners' perspectives differ from your analytical view?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance quantitative findings with qualitative insights? What role does organizational context play in interpreting data?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about the value of multiple perspectives in research? How might this influence your future professional practice?

objectives: Synthesize findings into coherent interim report
Receive feedback to guide final phase

activities.description: Draft and refine interim findings report
Present interim findings to Development Director
Read: Effective executive communication for nonprofits
Incorporate feedback and plan final analysis phase

dealReflection.describe: How did you structure your interim report? What feedback did you receive from your presentation?
dealReflection.examine: How did you translate technical findings for a non-technical audience? What communication strategies were most effective?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional communication? How has your confidence in presenting to professionals evolved?

objectives: Conduct detailed analysis of at-risk donor segments
Develop predictive indicators for retention risk

activities.description: Perform detailed analysis of highest-risk donor segments
Weekly mentor check-in: review methodology and findings
Read: Predictive analytics in nonprofit fundraising
Develop retention risk indicators and early warning signals

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what specific characteristics define your at-risk segments? What predictive indicators did you identify?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance statistical significance with practical significance? What ethical considerations arise in predictive modeling?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about translating complex analysis into practical tools? How might these skills transfer to other professional contexts?

objectives: Prioritize interventions by impact and feasibility

activities.description: Develop detailed recommendations for each donor segment
Discuss recommendations feasibility with Development Director
Read: Change management and implementation science basics
Refine and prioritize recommendations based on feasibility

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what recommendations did you develop? How did you prioritize them?
dealReflection.examine: How do organizational constraints (budget, staff, time) shape what's actionable? What's the difference between an ideal and a feasible recommendation?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about the gap between knowing what to do and being able to do it? How does this change your view of organizational decision-making?

objectives: Prepare supporting materials for final deliverables

activities.description: Finalize all analysis and create supporting documentation
Self-review analysis for gaps and clarity
Read: Best practices in analytical documentation
Create appendices and technical documentation

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what documentation did you create? How did you ensure others could understand and replicate your analysis?
dealReflection.examine: Why is documentation important in professional settings? How does it differ from academic requirements?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional standards for analytical work? How will this influence your future professional practice?

activities.description: Write final analysis report with recommendations
Review draft with mentor for feedback
Read: Writing effective executive summaries
Revise report based on feedback

dealReflection.describe: How did you structure your final report? What was most challenging about synthesizing all your work?
dealReflection.examine: How do you balance comprehensiveness with readability? What makes a report actionable rather than just informative?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional writing? How has your ability to communicate complex findings evolved?

activities.description: Create board presentation deck with key findings
Practice presentation and receive mentor feedback
Read: Presenting to executive audiences effectively
Refine presentation and prepare for Q&A

dealReflection.describe: How did you decide what to include in your presentation versus your report? How did practice sessions help you improve?
dealReflection.examine: What's different about presenting to a board compared to academic presentations? How do you adapt your communication style?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about executive communication? How has this experience built your confidence for future professional presentations?

activities.description: Deliver final presentation to Foundation board
Debrief with mentor on presentation and project
Read: Career reflection and professional identity development
Complete final reflection and project handoff documentation

dealReflection.describe: How did your final presentation go? What questions did the board ask? How did you handle unexpected questions?
dealReflection.examine: Looking back at the entire project, what were the most significant challenges and how did you overcome them? How did your understanding of professional work evolve?
dealReflection.articulate: What are the most important things you learned from this experience? How will this project influence your career path and professional identity?

assessment.overview: Assessment combines project deliverables demonstrating analytical competence, structured reflections showing learning and growth, and employer evaluation of professional performance.

deliverables.name: Interim Findings Report
criteria: Preliminary findings supported by data evidence
Identification of areas requiring further investigation

deliverables.name: Final Analysis and Recommendations
criteria: Comprehensive analysis of donor retention patterns

reflections.schedule: Weekly DEAL reflections submitted each Friday
criteria: Depth and specificity in describing experiences
Meaningful connections to prior learning and theory
Evidence of growth and developing professional identity

sampleWeek.subtitle: Moving from data to meaningful insights
objectives: Identify significant patterns in donor retention data
Distinguish meaningful signals from statistical noise

activities.description: Complete second analysis iteration with refined segmentation approach
Weekly mentor check-in: present initial patterns, gather practitioner feedback
Read: From Data to Decisions - Building compelling analytical arguments
Draft outline of key findings for interim report

deliverables: Analysis checkpoint: Key patterns identified with supporting evidence

dealReflection.describe: What patterns emerged from your analysis this week? What surprised you most about what the data revealed? What analytical techniques proved most useful?
dealReflection.examine: How do you distinguish correlation from causation in this organizational context? What additional information would make you more confident in your conclusions? How does this work connect to statistical concepts from your coursework?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about how organizations use data to make strategic decisions? How does this applied context differ from academic research methods you've learned?

kolbPhases.experience: Weekly project work including data analysis, stakeholder meetings, and report writing
kolbPhases.reflection: Weekly mentor check-ins and DEAL reflection processing of experiences
kolbPhases.conceptualization: Readings on nonprofit analytics, donor psychology, and professional communication
kolbPhases.experimentation: Iterative refinement of analysis, recommendations, and presentation materials

frameworkElements.dealReflections: Weekly structured reflections using Describe-Examine-Articulate Learning framework, building progressively toward comprehensive final reflection
frameworkElements.competencies: All four FieldWork experiential competencies addressed: Purposeful Engagement through authentic project work, Reflective Practice through DEAL reflections, Integrative Learning through connections to Psychology coursework, Transfer Capacity through career-focused final reflections

employerSuccessCriteria.criterion: Clear analysis of donor retention patterns with supporting data
Evidence-based recommendations the team can implement

studentLearningGoals.goal: Understand how organizations use data to make decisions
Build confidence communicating with senior professionals
Explore applications of psychology in business settings

institutionalOutcomes.outcome: Apply disciplinary knowledge to solve real-world problems
Reflect critically on personal and professional development
Collaborate effectively with professionals and stakeholders
